paper: ExaGPT_ Example-Based Machine-Generated Text Detection for Human Interpretability

differences.summary: Figure 5 scope mismatch between text and caption
differences.why_impacts_score: undermines clarity and trust in reported analysis coverage

evidence.baseline_quote: Plotted/tabular trends indicate performance decreases as α increases (Figure 5; Appendix C/Figure 10).
evidence.final_quote: Text asserts Figure 5 covers 'four domains and three generators,' but caption says 'across four domains using ChatGPT.'

differences.why_impacts_score: presentation inconsistency may mislead about best results

evidence.baseline_quote: Table 2 reports AUROC=100.0% for RoBERTa while Acc@1% FPR is 50.0%.
evidence.final_quote: Bolding rule appears inconsistently applied for AUROC (RoBERTa 100.0% vs. ExaGPT 99.2%; Table 2).

differences.summary: Clarity rationale expanded to include scope and bolding issues
differences.why_impacts_score: adds new reasons diminishing clarity and reliability

evidence.baseline_quote: Clarity: textual contradictions and missing protocol details (Equation 5 vs. Section 4.2; Table 2; Section 3.1).
evidence.final_quote: Clarity: contradictions plus Figure 5 scope and Table 2 bolding (Equation 5; Figure 5 scope; Table 2 bolding).

differences.summary: Explicit suggestion to align text–figure scope and reference other generators
differences.why_impacts_score: signals mismatch in claims that weakens generalization credibility

evidence.baseline_quote: Ensure Figure 5 and Appendix C/Figure 10 trends are consistently described.
evidence.final_quote: Align scope claims so text matches figure coverage; reference Appendix C/Figure 10 for other generators.
